text: PackageCompiler doesn't seem to precompile `@printf` calls from my module `X` when I do `create_sysimage(:X, ...)`.  I still see printf precompile calls when I run julia with `--trace-compile=stderr`. Is this a known issue or am I doing something wrong?

elements.text: .  I still see printf precompile calls when I run julia with
. Is this a known issue or am I doing something wrong?

text: Does the script you give PackageCompiler just lost your module, or does it also call the functions using `@printf`?

elements.text: Does the script you give PackageCompiler just lost your module, or does it also call the functions using

text: It looks like the issue is related to <https://github.com/JuliaLang/PackageCompiler.jl/pull/354> and linked issues. `@printf` doesn't print to a TTY when creating the sysimage, so it needs to compile when called for real. <@U67D54KS8> was this issue resolved somehow?

elements.text: It looks like the issue is related to
doesn't print to a TTY when creating the sysimage, so it needs to compile when called for real.

text: <https://github.com/JuliaLang/PackageCompiler.jl/commit/929657b22f3350ff1ed631ceb27dc6a715ef9a37> might have fixed it as a side-effect.
